p.span: We hope you've had a chance to check out our website redesign-we've made our voluntary learning instructional documents much easier to find. Please notice that we are making a change, in particular, to our 6-12 delivery. Starting Monday, all 6-12 teachers will be available on zoom from 10-11. Clark teachers will continue at times more convenient for their age groups and their familiies. During the sessions, teachers will be teaching lessons and conversing with students. Please note the schedule below and visit www.nlcsd.org for more information.

p.span:
HEAD HIGH SCHOOL GIRLS BASKETBALL COACH
BASIC FUNCTION:
To instruct participants in the fundamental skills, strategy and physical training necessary to realize a high degree of individual and team success. At the same time, the student-athlete shall receive instruction that will lead to the formulation and internalization of pride of accomplishment, self-discipline, self-confidence and sportsmanship. Additionally, this position will be asked to assist the Activities Director with the hiring of Assistants and Lower-Level coaches.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
1. Serves as the leader and manager for the Girls Basketball program.
2. Develops a regular practice schedule and organizes practice time to provide both individual and team development.
3. Coaches and instructs players, individually or in groups, regarding the rules, regulations, equipment, and techniques of the sport.
4. Follows state, regional, and district regulations governing the athletic program.
5. Establishes and maintains written standards of student behavior and provides proper supervision of athletes at all times.
6. Assigns duties to all assistant coaches under his/her jurisdiction; including out of season workouts.
7. Holds organizational meetings for team prospects and encourages potential athletes to participate in the sport.
8. Establishes a program philosophy that would including establishing a feeder program that may incorporate youth camps and clinics.
9. Ensures that appropriate rules and regulations regarding the conduct and eligibility of athletic activities and athletes are explained and followed.
10. Maintains eligibility forms, emergency data cards, insurance records, equipment inventory, and other related records.
11. Works with the Director of Activities and School Equity in scheduling facilities for practices and competition.
12. Monitors the academic performance of team members to ensure that eligibility requirements are met.
13. Assigns duties to all assistant coaches under his/her jurisdiction; including pre-season practice sessions.
14. Establishes and maintains written standards of student behavior and provides proper supervision of athletes at all times.
15. Conferences with parents/guardians, as necessary, regarding the athletic performance of their student.
16. Submits athlete rosters to the Activities Director before the first competition date.
17. Reports and secures approval from Activities Director for all adults associated with their sport/activity.
18. Models sportsman-like behavior and maintains appropriate conduct towards players, officials and spectators.
19. Acts as a team representative and promotes the sport by communicating with the news media, booster clubs, service clubs, and other organizations as requested by the Activities Director.
20. Follows established procedures for the proper care, maintenance, and requisitioning of equipment, supplies, and uniforms.
21. Works with Activities Director to develop a policy for awards and submits a list of award winners at the end of the season.
22. Participates in special activities to include parent’s night, banquets, award nights, and pep assemblies.
23. Follows and maintains knowledge of all district policies and procedures.
24. Models non-discriminatory practices in all activities.
25. Attends staff development meetings, clinics, and other professional development activities to improve coaching performance.
ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
1. Attend practices, games, and other functions on a prompt and regular basis.
2. Maintain confidentiality.
3. Maintain satisfactory and harmonious working relationships with the public, students, and other employees.
4. Assist with other duties as may be assigned.
REQUIREMENTS:
1. Valid IA Coaching Endorsement or Coaching Authorization
2. Strong Communication, public relations and interpersonal skills.
3. Coaching and/or leadership experience.
APPLICATIONS:
If interested please send a resume and letter of interest to ben.fry@nlcsd.org.
Reminder: The school buildings are open today from 11:30-6 for students to collect belongings that may have been left behind.

With the recent news of school closure for the remainder of the year we are scheduling a time for all students to gather their personal belongings that they may have left prior to March 16th. This Thursday, April 23rd the Elementary and MS/HS buildings will be open for students and parents to collect personal belongings. Our doors will be open from 11:30 - 6:00 and we will monitor the number of people that will be allowed to enter each building at a time. We ask our track athletes to also return their uniforms to the office during this time as well. If you are unable to collect your belongings they will be taken to the Central Office Building until the end of the month. At that time any belongings that are not collected will be donated to GoodWill or thrown away. Middle School and High School students this means your activity lockers as well must be cleaned out or locks will be cut off and items will be removed. We will schedule a Senior checkout date towards the end of May, along with a computer turn in day for all remaining K-11 students.

Will you have the kids spring pictures as well?

p.span:
Dear New London Families,
Today, Governor Kim Reynolds announced that all schools in Iowa will remain closed through the end of the school year to help prevent the further spread of COVID-19.
This announcement will continue to affect all New London Community School District programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events. Our current plan is to hold Prom and Graduation 3-4 weeks after the state lifts the social distancing measures. We know that this doesn’t help by giving you a firm date to make plans, but we don’t want to keep changing the dates of these events and then making everyone continue to make changes to their plans.
I know this decision has caused a great deal of concern and disappointment for our students, staff, and families. The pandemic arrived quickly, and when we were directed to close our school buildings in March, we didn’t realize it would be the last time we would see our students, in person, this school year. Please know that we share in your disappointment.
Per our district calendar, the last day of school for students is Thursday, May 28. We will continue with virtual learning until that date, just as we have over the past several weeks. We encourage all families to keep their students engaged in these activities to ensure learning continues to take place through the end of the school year. Our staff is ready to assist all families in these efforts, as well. To make things simpler for everyone, Mr. Munford designed the www.nlcsd.org website to be more user friendly to access the available resources, along with distinguishing specific times that the grade levels/teachers will be available to students or providing virtual links.
We need our families’ support in engaging students in the learning resources we have provided. Doing nothing from March 15 to August 24 will not prepare children to be successful next school year. Our staff is here to help you bridge this gap, and we are in the process of developing a plan for the rest of this school year and for when we return in the fall.
We will continue school lunch services, which will include breakfast, lunch, and a snack through the extended school closure, as well. We are also looking into providing this service during the summer months. We will provide further information regarding this service when we know we are able to provide it. Currently, we are providing 220 meals Monday – Friday from 11:30 – 12:30 to all children 0-18. If you would like to participate, you only need to come to the circle drive between 11:30-`12:30.
Once again, thank you for your patience, understanding, and flexibility during this unprecedented time. We will get through this together. Please continue to stay safe, practice social distancing, and remain at home as much as possible.
Yours in Education,
Chad Wahls, Scott Kracht, Todd Palmatier, Allsion Lair, and Jon Munford
#NLTigerPride

div.p: Deep down I expected this announcement but am still so saddened to hear it become reality. I have been so moved by the way our district has pulled together and tried so hard to help during the chaos right now. It really means so much to have such caring people working for the education of our children. You have been there to support them in anyway you can but also the families too. Thank you for all that you do for us. It is greatly appreciated.
I am glad the school and the governor is putting safety first when it comes to our children and our staff. Prayers for all to stay safe and healthy
Though I totally expected this, it’s sad. Even my 5th grader who has never cared for school is sad. Thank you for all you have done to help keep us abreast of the situation.
Fantastic job at providing the meals!
I miss my kiddos so much! 💔

p.span:
We have a family with children in our district who lost their home to a fire last night and they lost everything. They are in need of clothes and other essentials. If you want to donate to the family, you can drop items off at the district office any time today or during the parade tonight. Here are the sizes of clothing that they would need:
Male: Mens shirt size XXL and pant size 40
Female: Women's shirt size 2XXL/size 18/20, shoe size 11, and pant size 18/20
Girl teenager: Shirt size women's Large, shoe size 9, pant size 14
Boy youth: Shirt size youth Large/ size 18, shoe size youth 8, pant size 18 youth
Infant girl: 24 months
#NLTigerPride

I will go through. I should have some women,s larges. I will bring to Kim on Monday
We would like to donate some money by check. Who would we make it out to?
I have tons of women 2x dresses and shirts. And some jeans. Washing them now and dropping them off later
Anyone know if family is still in need of 24 months girls clothes?
Do you know the boys shoe size?
I can go through some stuff and let you know
Jessie English if I get clothes together can you drop off?

The teachers will begin their parade at Elliott's Chapel swing through the Care Initiatives Center and then work there way from the West side of town to the East side of town. We ask our out-of-town families to park along Main Street or around the park, we hope this will allow folks to keep their distance from each other.

p.span: Mrs. Alspach is currently working on scheduling for next year. Please make sure you are checking your emails regularly as Mrs. Alspach might have some questions regarding your schedules. #NLTigerPride

Dear Families,
I know your minds are spinning after the announcement from the Governor extending the school closure to April 30. If it keeps people safe and alive, it will be for the best in the bigger picture of life. Please continue to take care of yourselves and follow the CDC guidance.
I know many of you are going to ask now what school will look like. Based on the guidance from the Iowa Department of Education, we are going to continue to follow the voluntary educational enrichment pathway for providing learning opportunities for our students. Our other option was to move to a required educational service, which would hold all students to a graded/attendance plan. I do not feel that this option is possible given that our district is rural and internet coverage is not easily accessible by all of our students. We must keep in mind that if we were to grade assignments or work, what we would be grading is PRIVILEGE. Without the equalizing force of the school building and its service, limited as they are, teachers would be grading on access to wifi, food, housing, security, and ableism. This means that if we do not resume school this year, we will not be giving traditional letter grades, and semester two will not affect students’ GPAs. If we do resume school, our grades would pick up where we left off and we would continue to allow redos and retesting. This plan is fluid as we continue to receive guidance from the Iowa Department of Education.
By fulfilling one of these options, we will not be required to make these school days up. We know that we will have a lot to make up in our student’s education when they return, whether that be yet this year or the next school year. Our planning has shifted to focusing on how that will look and how we will accomplish it when we return. There is one exception to this: I want to make sure that every parent who has a child enrolled in a college class through SCC knows that they must fulfill all the requirements as this will continue to be a graded class. All SCC face-to-face courses are now online. This means that when the college professor or New London teacher teaching the online course either contacts you or submits to canvas assignments, lessons, reading material, or whatever the expectations are, you are required to complete it. If you're having any trouble with these courses please don’t hesitate to contact Mrs. Alspach for guidance.
The teachers will continue to support the enrichment pathway, and we will be providing learning opportunities and activities for families to use ranging from packets, online programs designed to promote skill development, Google Classroom lessons, zoom sessions, Facebook live and many other optional resources. Please remind your children to check their emails and other online resources often. We understand that this request places a huge burden onto parents, especially for younger students. We will not over task our students during this time since we understand that each of our families have unique challenges that they will be continuing to face in the coming weeks. As I said before, we will work our tails off to get our students caught up when we get back to school so parents SHOULD NOT STRESS. We’ve got this!!!
If you do not have internet access and your child needs a packet rather than online resources, please contact your building principal. We are also aiming, extra WiFi access points at several points in the district so that students can park and use the WiFi; stay, in your cars though--social distancing is important and we can’t have groups of students congregating there. Those locations are the northeast corner of Clark (the current fifth grade classrooms), the Clark staff doors (the fourth grade rooms), the concession stand, outside of the Clark library, the high school art room, and the concession stand.
So what will the next few days look like for our families? Our teachers will continue to send out materials for students to work on. Depending on the student’s age they should be contacted by their teacher via email. If you have not heard from your child’s teacher please reach out to them. If you continue to have issues, please contact the building principal.
Our priority right now is to ensure our students are staying connected with school and taking care of themselves. We are in uncharted waters at this time and we need to be sensitive to what is going on in our families' lives. Parents are doing a wonderful job, and please, again, do not stress. You are doing enough. Just remember to love them. As strange as this is to us, it is even more so for our kids. If you have a child who is struggling and needs someone to talk to, please reach out to the school. We have counselors ready and willing to work with your child. We love them too.
As for future events such as activities, we will follow the guidance of the athletic and fine arts associations. In regards to school events such as prom and graduation, we plan to fulfill these events even if it means that we would hold them as late as the beginning of August. Graduation is a special time for each family and we will make sure it is special even though it may be very unique and nontraditional. I ask you to have patience during this time. We will keep you informed and will have more information for you in the near future.
We will be putting together a question and answer about the choice of required educational services versus voluntary educational enrichment services to help answer questions you may have. If you have a question that you would like answered please email your question to Chad Wahls at chad.wahls@nlcsd.org.
As always, if you have questions or need support, please do not hesitate to reach out. My phone number is 319-367-0512 ext. 1104 or email me at chad.wahls@nlcsd.org. Continue to keep our families, community, and state in your thoughts and prayers.
Yours in Education,
Chad Wahls, Scott Kracht, Todd Palmatier, Allison Lair, and Jon Munford

div.p: Thank you so much to all have put in so much work during this crazy uncharted time! It does not go unappreciated! From lunches to school pantry to educating our kiddos I am so thankful for all that everyone has done!!
Thank you for all that you guys have done to help the families during this difficult time.
Hope you do not open the school back up this year! Don't see how you can practice social distancing. Please keep our kids safe and wait til the Fall
Thank you so so much for all the hard work you have been putting in and making this time easier. I love all of our teachers and staff. You are making a difference!!!
Heidi Hedgecock, I accidentally deleted your question, I think. Yes, students will still receive credit.

p.span: Today our Governor announced that schools would continue to be closed through April 30th. In addition to the extended closure, we have been provided with updated guidance in regards to the expectations of how schools will further provide educational services to our students. We will provide further guidance for these services in the upcoming days as we want to review the material before sending out our plan.

section.div:
The mission of the New London Community School District, through the combined resources of school, home, and community, is to guide, challenge, and motivate life-long learning in an environment that fosters individual success, mutual respect, pride, and personal accountability.
For a full list of non discrimination statements please visit our website http://www.nlcsd.org/nds/

div.h2: Notice: New London CSD is officially closed for the remainder of the school year. The buildings will be inaccessible to all but essential staff until further notice. Communication will continue via text messages, Facebook, and the website.
